implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the REST endpoint '/tasks' (POST) that receives task creation requests. Accepts task data and delegates creation to the service layer.
implementation.name: create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to '/tasks' with task data:
    Try to create a new task using the service layer
    If successful, return the created task
    If an error occurs, raise an HTTP exception

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements business logic for creating a task. Receives task data from the endpoint and passes it to the repository for storage.
implementation.name: TaskService.create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Log the creation attempt for the user
Call repository.add_task with the provided task data
Return the result from the repository

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles storage of the new task. Receives task data, assigns an ID, stores it in an in-memory list, and returns the created task object.
implementation.name: TaskRepository.add_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Create a new Task object with a unique ID and provided fields
Append the Task to the internal task list
Increment the ID counter
Log the creation
Return the Task object

missing_implementations: No persistent database storage; tasks are stored in-memory and will be lost on restart.
No input validation for required fields (Title, Description, Priority, Due date, User_name) beyond model definition.
No authentication or user verification for User_name field.
No UI component for task creation (only backend logic present).
